intro: Daucus masclefii, commonly known as the Mascle's fennel, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. It typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the island's unique climate. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
